webvr a-framr app, pepperoni pizza
Make sure everything is in a single HTML file with embedded CSS and JS in a single code block to be used as a web app.

Creating a simple WebVR A-Frame app that displays a 3D model of a pepperoni pizza can be accomplished using A-Frame's capabilities. Below is a self-contained HTML file that you can save as `.html` and open in a compatible web browser to see the pizza.

```html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
  <head>
    <meta charset="utf-8">
    <title>Pepperoni Pizza VR</title>
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0, user-scalable=no">
    <script src="https://aframe.io/releases/1.2.0/aframe.min.js"></script>
    <style>
      body { margin: 0; }
      canvas { width: 100%; height: 100%; }
    </style>
  </head>
  <body>
    <a-scene embedded>
      <!-- Add a sky -->
      <a-sky color="#87CEEB"></a-sky>

      <!-- Camera rig for VR -->
      <a-entity camera look-controls position="0 1.6 0">
      </a-entity>

      <!-- Ground -->
      <a-plane rotation="-90 0 0" width="10" height="10" color="#7BC8A4"></a-plane>

      <!-- Pepperoni Pizza -->
      <a-cylinder position="0 0.1 -2" radius="0.5" height="0.1" color="#e7b263" segments-radial="30">
        <a-sphere position="0 0 0.05" radius="0.1" color="#9e3a28" ></a-sphere>
        <a-sphere position="0.2 0 0.05" radius="0.08" color="#9e3a28" ></a-sphere>
        <a-sphere position="-0.2 0 0.05" radius="0.08" color="#9e3a28" ></a-sphere>
        <a-sphere position="0 0.2 0.05" radius="0.08" color="#9e3a28" ></a-sphere>
        <a-sphere position="0 0.25 0.05" radius="0.1" color="#9e3a28" ></a-sphere>
        <a-sphere position="0.15 -0.1 0.05" radius="0.07" color="#9e3a28" ></a-sphere>
      </a-cylinder>

      <!-- Light -->
      <a-light type="ambient" color="#FFF"></a-light>
      <a-light type="directional" color="#FFF" position="-1 1 1"></a-light>
    </a-scene>
    
    <script>
      // Additional JavaScript logic can be added here.
    </script>
  </body>
</html>
```

### Explanation of the Code:
- **A-Frame Library**: This code uses the A-Frame library to create a VR scene.
- **Sky and Ground**: A sky is created for the background, and a plane acts as the ground.
- **Pepperoni Pizza Representation**: A cylinder is used to represent the pizza base, and multiple spheres are placed on top to represent pepperoni slices.
- **Camera**: A camera is rigged using `look-controls` to allow users to look around in VR.
- **Lights**: Ambient and directional lighting is included to illuminate the scene.

### Instructions to Run:
1. Copy the entire code into a new text file.
2. Save the file with a `.html` extension (e.g., `pizza-vr.html`).
3. Open the file in a web browser that supports WebVR, such as Google Chrome or Firefox.
4. For full VR experience, if you have a VR headset, you may access the virtual reality features directly.

Enjoy your creation of the Pepperoni Pizza in VR!
